question: 病人
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>person</kanji> who is <kanji>sick</kanji> is a <vocabulary>sick person</vocabulary>. They are also a <vocabulary>patient</vocabulary>, at least we can hope they are, for their sake.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>人</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Every <vocabulary>sick person</vocabulary> enjoys playing on their <reading>Nin</reading>tendo (<ja>にん</ja>). You have the nastiest flu, but you've still got your Nintendo, so everything is fine.
